title: Isla Fisher sports a pink blouse and leather mini skirt as she leaves private members club
text:
It is reportedly the most exclusive private members club in West Hollywood.

And Isla Fisher was spotted leaving the San Vicente Bungalows following dinner on Thursday night, before meeting up with a pal and her pooch outside.

The actress, 43, cut a stylish figure for her swanky dinner date in a floral pink blouse which she teamed with a chic brown leather mini skirt.

Glam: Isla Fisher was spotted leaving the San Vicente Bungalows following dinner on Thursday night, before meeting up with a pal and her pooch outside

She styled her look with a pair of stylish block heels complete with an oversized buckle, boosting her petite frame some extra inches.

The Now You See Me star toted a circular satchel bag over her shoulder and wore a pair of wayfarer-style shades tucked into her pretty blouse.

Isla wore her flame-hued tresses in a bouncy blown out style and added to her look with light touches of make-up.

Chic: The actress, 43, cut a stylish figure for her swanky dinner date in a floral pink blouse which she teamed with a chic brown leather mini skirt

Outside the restaurant Isla stopped to chat to a woman and her pet pooch, as she was pictured stroking the French bulldog on the head.

Isla is a mother-of-three to Olive, 10, Elula, seven, and Montgomery, three - whom she shares with actor, producer and comedian Sacha Baron Cohen, 47.

The couple met at a party in Sydney in 2002, became engaged in 2004 and tied the knot in a Jewish ceremony in Paris in 2010 after Isla converted to Judaism

The Confessions Of A Shopaholic star recently admitted she still finds Sacha attractive when he's dressed up as his comic alter-egos Ali G, Borat and Bruno.

Isla appeared on Busy Tonight in March to answer questions about which character of Sacha's she would sleep with.

When host Busy Philipps held up a picture of Ali G, Isla answered without hesitation: 'I've got the biggest b*ner. I've got a b*ner. That's my hall pass right there.'

Speaking in an interview with Marie Claire magazine last year, Isla revealed her desire to return home to her native Australia.

The Perth-raised star also spoke about the challenges of bringing up children in Los Angeles, adding: 'Juggling a family in LA isn't easy. There's not really a culture of bringing your kids to dinner parties or to restaurants past 6pm.

'I tend to entertain at home because I want to be with my family - it's easier to put your kids to bed and have a wine with friends.'
